cause.description:
A little about Michael Bloomberg: He is currently the Mayor of New York City and the founder of the Bloomberg media company. Though a lifelong democrat, he ran on the republican ticket in 2001 for mayor. In June 2007 he left the republican party and is currently an independent and an ideal candidate for a third party.
Bloomberg's stances and accomplishments as mayor:
Gay Marriage-
"My personal opinion is that anybody should be allowed to marry anybody. I don't happen to think we should put restrictions on who you should marry"
Public Health-
Bloomberg extended New York City's smoking ban to all commercial establishments, including bars and nightclubs. On 5 December 2006, New York became the first city in the United States to ban trans-fat from all restaurants. It will go into effect in July of 2008
Enviroment-
Bloomberg is transforming all city cabs and buses into hybrids
Immigration-
He argues that deportation breaks up families and scares illegal immigrants away from cooperating with law enforcement or accessing vital social services.
Gun Control-
Bloomberg is a strong advocate of gun control and made it a major issue of his administration in his second inaugural address. "I don't know why people carry guns. Guns kill people..."
Death Penalty- (watch) http://youtube.com/watch?v=O3dIJfaqSHc
1. Bloomberg for President
